pullRequest.title: Stop Serializing RepositoryData Twice when Writing
pullRequest.bodyText:
We can save one round of serializing RepositoryData on the write path.
This also leads to somewhat better compression because we compress larger chunks
in one go potentially when compared to serializing and compressing in one go.
Also, fixed the double wrapping of collections when copying the repository
data instance via the withGenId.

commit.message:
Stop Serializing RepositoryData Twice when Writing

We can save one round of serializing `RepositoryData` on the write path.
This also leads to somewhat better compression because we compress larger chunks
in one go potentially when compared to serializing and compressing in one go.
Also, fixed the double wrapping of collections when copying the repository
data instance via the `withGenId`.
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:elastic/elasticsearch into fix-double-serialization-repository-data

nodes.bodyText: Still kind of awkward to right away serialize what we just read but I didn't want to make the bigger changes required for not having to serialize here in this PR + it's a rare spot to get here anyway and only applies to the first load of repository data on a master node.
I think it's a bit weird to set this only at the very end. I think we shuld set the new genId on the RepositoryData object as soon as we have final long newGen = setPendingStep.result();?
